sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now. Here are your headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Red Cross says its attempt to evacuate civilians from the besieged city of Mariupol has failed,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: as conditions made it impossible to continue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Ukraine says Russia has seized humanitarian aid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Russia accuses Ukrainian helicopters of attacking a fuel depot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: If confirmed, it would be the first time Russia has reported a Ukrainian airstrike on its territory since the war began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: China says it will push for peace its own way in Ukraine

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: at its first summit with the EU in two years.

sentences.sentence: EU chief von der Leyen warns China of the consequences if it helps Russia's war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And Latvia is the latest country to ban public displays of support for Russia's military using the letter Z.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I'm Helena Humphrey, good to have you with us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Up to 2,000 people have been evacuated from the city of Mariupol through the latest openings of humanitarian corridors, making their escape on buses supplied by Kyiv. But the International Committee of the Red Cross failed to carry out their planned evacuations, as its team said that conditions were not safe to travel to the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The aid organization says around 150,000 people remain trapped there and that it will try again on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's government welcomed the evacuation efforts but has accused Russia of stealing much-needed humanitarian supplies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Unfortunately, humanitarian aid was taken away by the occupiers, 14 tons worth of food and medicine.

sentences.sentence: This is the price of agreements, this is the price of guarantees given to the International Committee of the Red Cross, that humanitarian corridors would be guaranteed and would work.

sentences.sentence: We're negotiating the return of buses so that the residents of Melitopol can leave for Saporizhia tomorrow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile Russia says an oil depot near the border with Ukraine was attacked by helicopter gunships.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Officials from the Belgorod region say that two Ukrainian helicopters crossed the border and struck the facility with missiles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: If confirmed, it would be the first engagement by Ukraine against Russia on Russian soil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: However, Ukraine's foreign minister says he can neither confirm nor deny that Kyiv was behind the operation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Tracking the latest developments across Ukraine is our correspondent Sasha Vakulina, and she explained that no one has yet claimed responsibility for the Belgorod oil depot attack.

This is not, we're talking Chernihiv and Kyiv. This is where we can see counter-offensive by Ukrainian forces.

This is the big city that is in the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Ivan Fedorov, the Ukrainian mayor, recently freed after being kidnapped by Russian soldiers, has given a personal account of his ordeal to the French president, Emmanuel Macron, in Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Fedorov also spoke to our international correspondent, Anneliese Borges, where he described his experience in captivity.

He said he wanted to continue his work but that Russian soldiers grew increasingly angry at him, local elected officials but also at the population and on March 11th we all saw those pictures, those security images showing Fedorov with a plastic bag over his head being taken away by 10 Russian soldiers. He said he was interrogated mostly at night during the five days he stayed in captivity and he was then later released in a prisoner exchange deal. This is what he had to say. sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The EU and China have held their first high-level summit in two years, with the bloc's leaders speaking virtually to President Xi Jinping.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The two powers discussed the war in Ukraine with Brussels seeking Beijing's help to end the conflict. Shona Murray reports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As war and untethered violence rage in Ukraine, the EU says China must actively show its commitment to restoring world peace. It says turning a blind eye and playing equidistant are not an option either.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A high-level EU-China summit took place in Brussels, with both sides meeting for the first time since 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukraine and China's relations with Russia dominated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: China has an influence on Russia, and therefore we expect China to take its responsibility to end this war and to come back, that Russia comes back to a peaceful negotiations solution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We expect China, if not supporting the sanctions, at least to do everything not to interfere in any kind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Brussels warned China the country could face consequences should it help Russia evade sanctions or provide military support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The priority, the EU says, has to be global stability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Bilateral trade, key for China, was also high on the agenda, but everything depends on finding a level playing field for both sides.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And that won't come easy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A big lesson from the current war is that having a business, having dependencies on countries that don't share your values can have a huge cost.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And so I think what the lesson that many Europeans might take, public opinion and leaderships, is that we might need to rethink our relationships with China and even maybe question this idea of China being a partner, a competitor and a rival.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The summit ended without a joint statement, with Brussels and Beijing still showing very opposing views.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Chinese President Xi Jinping urged the EU to focus on ending world turbulence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Shona Murray, Euronews, Brussels.
